about.title: What is HackUConn?
about.description: HackUConn is a 24-hour marathon event that brings together students of all disciplines in hopes of finding innovative solutions for today’s biggest problems. Students are provided mentoring and workshops from industry professionals and are tasked with bringing their solutions to life. Not a programmer or a coder? No problem! HackUConn tasks teams and individuals with providing any solution to the given topic, ranging from applications to material prototypes to strategic plans and more. At HackUConn, there’s a spot for everyone!

current.aboutdescription1: In a world where climate change is more important than ever, we decided that the topic of sustainability would be an amazing opportunity for students of all majors to showcase their creativity. Students will have to come up with a solution to a specific problem based on several topics (TBD) through collaboration, innovation, and development. If you want the chance to broadcast your knowledge to the public on what YOU think can be done to help create a sustainable future, then HackUConn is for you!

fifth.title: Best Tech Hack
fifth.description: GitHub Swag + No Bounds BlueTooth speaker

questions.question: What is a hackathon?
questions.answer: A hackathon is a multi-day event where students from all over the world can come together to build projects that have the potential to change the world. The great thing about hackathons is that they teach students about software and hardware development while also allowing them to explore their creativity and ideas with no limits. By the end, students will learn new skills and make valuable connections for the future.

questions.question: When and where is it?
questions.answer: HackUconn will be taking place fully online on March 13th and 14th, 2021. Details on how to access the corresponding materials will be given closer to the date of the event.

questions.question: Who can participate?
questions.answer: Students of all majors from any school are welcome to participate! Even if you don’t have any coding experience, there will still be plenty of opportunities for you to make a contribution and have a chance to win!

questions.question: How much does it cost?
questions.answer: HackUConn is completely free! Not only is the event costless, but you will also receive some cool swag if you participate!

questions.question: What do I need?
questions.answer: Since this year HackUConn will be virtual, all you need is a device that connects to the internet and 24 hours dedicated to the competition! We will also be using Zoom and Discord, so being familiar with those platforms is a plus.

questions.question: What is the theme of this year's HackUConn?
questions.answer: This year's competition completely revolves around environmental sustainability. The goal is to make sure that everyone involved, regardless of their major or background, can succeed in the competition!

questions.question: Will there be prizes?
questions.answer: Yep! Each team will have a chance to compete for one of our coveted prizes. Check them out above!

questions.question: How do I go about creating/finding a team?
questions.answer: Overall team size is limited to 5 people max. If you are coming with a team, make sure to state that in the registration form. If you don’t have a team, that’s no problem! We will have team forming events before we kickoff, so check those out on the schedule!

questions.question: How do I register?
questions.answer: If registration is open, there should be a button at the top of the website called 'registration'. That will link you to our registration page. If it is not there, registrations are unfortunately closed, but feel free to keep checking for our next event!

questions.question: When can I start hacking?
questions.answer: Hacking can only be done during the annouced hacking period. Also note that no prior work/projects can be brought in.
